div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: To: Parents and Students of the Lamar School District

div.p: Following a meeting by the Lamar School District administrative team and in consultation with various state agencies, a decision was made to address the manner in which grades will be assigned for the online and take-home work that our students are currently completing during this period of self-isolation. As the governor has extended the statewide stay at home order, and ordered schools to be closed until April 30th, it is becoming increasingly likely that schools could remain shut down for the rest of the school year. It is with this possibility in mind that we are making the following adjustment: Student grades as of March 12th (our last in-person contact date) will form a baseline for the final grade that a student can receive. Any work performed online or at home after this date will only have positive impact on the grade that will appear on the student’s transcript.

We understand that there are a number of you who are struggling to learn in this online environment having heard your concerns in phone calls, text messages, and emails. Our teachers and administrators wish we were in the building and that our students were being taught in our classrooms under normal circumstances, but unfortunately this is not going to be possible for at least a few more weeks. During this difficult time, we want to encourage you to continue to do your best on your online and take-home assignments and assure you that your grades will not suffer during this difficult and challenging time.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: In an attempt to limit exposure of staff, volunteers, parents, and children to COVID-19, food service will be shifting from a daily distribution schedule to a twice weekly distribution schedule.

h3.div: Beginning Monday, April 13, 2020, meals will be distributed at all sites on Mondays and Thursdays.

p.em: You will receive Monday through Wednesday's meals on Monday, and Thursday through Sunday's meals on Thursday.

div.p: We will continue to offer these meals in a drive-up, take and go style from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at all of the current locations:

h3.div: Please go to the site in your neighborhood.

p.strong: We appreciate all of your support and cooperation as we continue to navigate these trying times.

div.p: Please Click HERE for Traffic Flow Information for each site!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: En un intento por limitar la exposición del personal, los voluntarios, los padres y los niños a COVID-19, el servicio de alimentos cambiará de un horario de distribución diario a un horario de distribución dos veces por semana. A partir del lunes 13 de abril de 2020, las comidas se distribuirán en todos los sitios los lunes y jueves. Recibirá las comidas de lunes a miércoles los lunes y las comidas de jueves a domingo los jueves. Continuaremos ofreciendo estas comidas en un estilo “drive-up, take and go” en todas las ubicaciones actuales (High School, Washington Elementary, Lincoln Elementary y Parkview Elementary) de 11 am a 1 pm. Apreciamos todo su apoyo y cooperación mientras continuamos navegando estos tiempos difíciles.

h3.div: Grab & Go Meals WILL continue to be served

ul.li: Email selections to: libraryinlamar@gmail.com with your library card information.
The items will be pulled, bagged, and you can pick up at the back door of the library.
Please call ahead to check and make sure everything is ready!

h3.div: No Library Card? A temporary card can be issued.

div.p: Items are on a first come, first serve basis.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: Click HERE for the Official Press Release

h2.div: Update - Governor Polis EXTENDs CLOSURE TO APRIL 30

div.p: The Governor signed an executive order suspending in-person learning in public and private schools across the state from March 23 to April 30. The executive order directs Colorado school districts and the Charter School Institute to make every effort to provide alternative learning opportunities during this time while taking into account the needs of local communities. This order also directs the Commissioner of Education to issue guidance to support P-12 school systems in developing and implementing plans to assist families and students in accessing alternative learning, providing free and reduced lunch and breakfast, and offering waivers for instructional time as appropriate. Click here to read.
